resources.string: Founded in 1856, Zeche Minister Stein was a coal mine in Dortmund Eving. Since 1871, it was named after the Prussian Minister Karl Freiherr vom Stein. In 1925, a serious explosion occurred and 136 people were killed. Minister Stein was a long time only indirectly affected from the close-down of coal mines in the Ruhr area, but in 1987 it also had to close.
